channel.title: NHC Eastern North Pacific
channel.description: Active tropical cyclones in the Eastern North Pacific

item.title: Eastern North Pacific Tropical Weather Outlook
item.description:
719
ABPZ20 KNHC 181137
TWOEP

Tropical Weather Outlook
NWS National Hurricane Center Miami FL
500 AM PDT Tue Jul 18 2023

For the eastern North Pacific...east of 140 degrees west longitude:

South-Southwest of Southwestern Mexico:
Disorganized showers and thunderstorms located a few hundred miles
south-southwest of the coast of southwestern Mexico are associated
with a tropical wave. Some slow development of this system is
possible during the next few days as it moves west-northwestward at
10 to 15 mph over the central portion of the eastern Pacific basin.
By this weekend, the system is forecast to move over cooler waters,
and further development is not expected.
* Formation chance through 48 hours...low...10 percent.
* Formation chance through 7 days...low...20 percent.

$$
Forecaster Reinhart
item.author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)

item.title: There are no tropical cyclones at this time.
item.description: No tropical cyclones as of Tue, 18 Jul 2023 14:34:58 GMT
